questions.text: Three components of PCR involve all, except:

Extended spectrum β-lactamases (ESBL) producing organisms are resistant to all, except:

questions.correct_answer: A. Kirby Bauer disc diffusion method
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Kirby Bauer disc diffusion method

questions.text: Correct sequence of bacterial growth curve:

options.label: A
options.text: Log phase - Lag phase - Stationary phase - Decline phase

options.label: B
options.text: Lag phase - Log phase - Stationary phase - Decline phase

options.label: C
options.text: Stationary phase - Lag phase - Log phase - Decline phase

options.label: D
options.text: Lag phase - Exponential phase - Log phase - Death phase

questions.correct_answer: B. Lag phase - Log phase - Stationary phase - Decline phase
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Lag phase - Log phase - Stationary phase - Decline phase

questions.text: Which of the following is the principle of this test?

A 26-year-old man comes to the office due to a 3 days history of dysuria and urethral discharge. The symptoms developed about 2 weeks after he had unprotected sexual intercourse with a new partner. His temperature is 37.1°C (98.8°F). On physical examination, a mucoid discharge is expressed with gentle milking of the penis. Gram stain of the discharge reveals numerous neutrophils with intracellular diplococci. A sample of the discharge is placed on an antibiotic-containing medium, and bacterial colonies are cultured. Which of the following terms best describes the medium?

A 12-year-old child presents with fever and cervical lymphadenopathy. Oral examination shows a gray membrane on the right tonsil. Which of the following will be ideal for rapid identification of the pathogen.

Advantages of saline mount are all, except:

options.label: A
options.text: Useful in the detection of trophozoites and cysts of protozoan parasites and eggs and larvae of helminths

options.label: B
options.text: Nuclear details of cysts and helminthic eggs and larvae are better visualized

options.label: C
options.text: Motility of trophozoites and larvae can be seen in acute infection

options.label: D
options.text: Bile staining property can be appreciated

questions.correct_answer: B. Nuclear details of cysts and helminthic eggs and larvae are better visualized
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Nuclear details of cysts and helminthic eggs and larvae are better visualized

In addition to the apparent tropism for joints, the virus causing above illness is highly tropic for which cell type?

options.label: C

questions.correct_answer: C. PCR assay for viral DNA in CSF

A child was brought with complaints of high fever, multiple seizures, headache, and neck rigidity. CSF analysis showed low glucose, high protein, and many polymorphs. The CSF culture showed pleomorphic gram-negative bacilli. What is true about the causative organism?

options.label: B
options.text: Produces non-lactose fermenting colonies on MacConkey agar

options.label: C
options.text: Exhibits satellitism around Staphylococcus aureus colonies

options.label: D
options.text: It exhibits alpha hemolysis on sheep blood agar

questions.correct_answer: C. Exhibits satellitism around Staphylococcus aureus colonies
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Exhibits satellitism around Staphylococcus aureus colonies

questions.text: Which pathogen causes attachment-effacement lesion in the intestinal mucosa?

A patient was suspected to have acute brucellosis. A serum sample was sent for a standard agglutination test. It came out to be negative initially but after serial dilutions of the serum sample, the test turned out to be positive. Which of the following is responsible for the initial negative test?
A child who is regularly eating outside is presenting with icterus and diarrhea, which of the following infectious agent can spread through the Feco-oral route?

A patient presented with multiple asymptomatic scaly patches varying in color from white to tan to brown to pink. On potassium hydroxide wet mount spaghetti and meat ball appearance is seen. Which of the following is causative organism for this disease?

A 30-year-old worker named John presents with swollen lymph nodes in his left armpit. He recently got bitten by fleas while working in a wheat godown. The affected area is red and tender. To investigate the cause, a smear from his axillary lymph node is examined. Which is the most suitable stain for this examination?
A militant presents with rashes all over his body sparing the palms and soles. On examination, he was febrile and lice were noted. Which of the following is responsible for his condition?

A patient from Uttar Pradesh presented with fever, pallor, and hepatosplenomegaly. Peripheral smear examination showed pancytopenia. Buffy coat examination showed macrophages laden with organisms with a kinetoplast. What is the vector for the likely disease?

A patient admitted with 50% burns develops an infection at the burn site. The swab was cultured, the isolate is a strict aerobe and the test that is shown in the image is positive. What is the likely etiology of the burn infection?

A group of 20 friends kept partying till late at night. Two of them ate pastries from outside. They present with nausea and vomiting in the early morning. What is the most likely causative agent implicated?

A Cattle farmer with a scab lesion in the arm. Microscopic examination shows brick/box shaped gram-positive organism with squared ends and spores in the centre. Most likely organism which is responsible for his condition is?
Gram positive alpha hemolytic cocci with catalase negative and optochin resistant causing endocarditis?

An elderly male patient who received a kidney transplant a decade ago is presently under immunosuppressive treatment. He reports experiencing a persistent cough and shortness of breath over the past week. Microscopic examination of his sputum reveals the presence of gram-positive budding yeast cells and pseudohyphae. What is the probable diagnosis in this case?

options.label: D
options.text: Information is not enough for the diagnosis
